p: A few in vitro studies have also investigated the utility of remdesivir against non-human CoVs. For example, a study by Murphy et al. reported anti-CoV activity of remdesivir's parent nucleoside, GS-441524, against an alphacoronavirus that only infects wild and domestic cats, the feline infectious peritonitis (FIP) virus (EC 50 = 0.78 μM; Table 1) [ 14]. In 2019, Brown et al. observed some antiviral effects of remdesivir against SARS-like bat CoVs (specifically, Bat-CoV HKU3, Bat-CoV SCH014, and Bat-CoV WIV1) and MERS-like bat CoVs (specifically, Bat-CoV HKU5) [ 12].
